tasks.task: Understanding and implementing Good Agricultural Practices (GAP) for rice cultivation and certification.
subtasks: Familiarize with UN FAO's GAP concept and its purpose of ensuring safe and healthy agricultural products throughout supply chains.
Learn about the successful application of GAP in horticulture and its expansion to rice commodities in Southeast Asia.
Assess the challenges in national and international ratification of GAP standards for rice to ensure accreditation and economic incentives.
Explore the development of rice GAP in countries like Vietnam, Thailand, and the Philippines for both export and domestic markets.
Collaborate with governmental bodies (e.g., Vietnamese provincial and national governments) to implement GAP practices, such as the "five reductions, one must do" initiative in the Mekong Delta.
Integrate natural resource management techniques into pre- and post-harvest practices to ensure sustainable rice cultivation.

tasks.task: Supporting the roll-out of GAP practices in rice farming.
subtasks: Work closely with farmers, agricultural extension agents, and local authorities to disseminate GAP knowledge and encourage adoption.
Conduct training sessions and provide resources for farmers on GAP principles, risk assessment, and best practices.
Facilitate farmer group certification processes and monitor their adherence to GAP standards.
Advocate for supportive policies and economic incentives for GAP-compliant farmers to ensure long-term sustainability.
Promote the integration of GAP into national agricultural systems and international trade agreements to maintain market access for certified products.

tasks.task: Monitoring and evaluating the impact of GAP implementation on rice production.
subtasks: Collect data on resource use, environmental impact, and socio-economic benefits derived from GAP practices.
Assess the effectiveness of GAP certification in enhancing product safety and nutritional value.
Regularly update GAP guidelines and practices based on feedback and new research findings.
Collaborate with educational institutions and research organizations to develop innovative methods for GAP implementation.
Share best practices and lessons learned with stakeholders in the region and beyond to contribute to global agricultural sustainability.
